translated: As It Was Said
The Collection of Groups of Ones
The Third Section
Giving

analyzed: vuttam ha etam bhagavatā vuttam arahatā iti me suta
translated: This was said by the Blessed One, said by the Arahant, so I have heard:

original: “Evañce, bhikkhave, sattā jāneyyuṁ dānasaṁvibhāgassa vipākaṁ yathāhaṁ jānāmi, na adatvā bhuñjeyyuṁ, na ca nesaṁ maccheramalaṁ cittaṁ pariyādāya tiṭṭheyya.
analyzed: evam ce bhikkhave sattāḥ jāneyyum dāna savibhāgassa vipākam yathā aham jānāmi na a datvā bhuñjeyyu na ca na īsam macchera malam cittam pariyādāya tiṭṭheyya
translated: “Monks, if beings knew, as I know, the result of giving and sharing, they would not eat without having given, nor would they allow the stain of selfishness to obsess their minds.

original: Yopi nesaṁ assa carimo ālopo carimaṁ kabaḷaṁ, tatopi na asaṁvibhajitvā bhuñjeyyuṁ, sace nesaṁ paṭiggāhakā assu.
analyzed: yaḥ api na isam assa carimaḥ ālopo carimam tatas api na bhuñjeyyu sace na isam paṭiggāhakāḥ assu
translated: Even if it were their last bite, their last mouthful, they would not eat without having shared it, if there were someone to share it with.

original: Yasmā ca kho, bhikkhave, sattā na evaṁ jānanti dānasaṁvibhāgassa vipākaṁ yathāhaṁ jānāmi, tasmā adatvā bhuñjanti, maccheramalañca nesaṁ cittaṁ pariyādāya tiṭṭhatī”ti.
analyzed: yasmai ca kho bhikkhave sattāḥ na evam jānanti dāna savibhāgassa vipākam yathā aham jānāmi tasmai a datvā bhuñjanti macchera malam ca na īsam cittam pariyādāya tiṭṭhati iti
translated: But because beings do not know, as I know, the result of giving and sharing, they eat without having given, and the stain of selfishness obsesses their minds.”
The Blessed One said this.
And in connection with this, it was said:
“If beings knew, as I know,🔽The result of giving and sharing,
As to how it has great fruit,🔽The stain of selfishness would not obsess their minds.
Having removed the stain of selfishness,
with a mind of confidence,
they give in time to the noble ones,
where a gift is very fruitful.
Having given food to many,
an offering to those worthy of offerings,
from here, when they pass away from the human state,
the givers go to heaven.
And having gone to heaven, there
they delight in sensual pleasures,
they experience the result of sharing,

original: anubhonti amaccharā”ti.🔽Ayampi attho vutto bhagavatā, iti me sutanti.
analyzed: anubhonti amaccharāti  ayam pi atthaḥ vuttaḥ bhagavatā iti me sutam ti
translated: without stinginess.”
This is the meaning of what the Buddha said. Thus I have heard:
